Description: Confidence score, 0 (Low Confidence), 1 (Medium Confidence) and 2 (High Confidence)
mRNA identifier, can be gene symbol or refseq name
Probability of the binding. This is only tre for miRDB and is from 0 to 100
Auto -incremental Mature miRNA ID of mirBase
The mirBase ID of species that is linked to mirna_species
Some information of the microRNA, some examples are where is it found, what function it may have, etc.
Accession number for a microRNA. This unique identifier is used to map microRNA sequences and annotations within the database, ensuring consistency and traceability across related datasets
This is the mature name of the microRNA
This is the old mature name of the microRNA

This column specifies the ending base pair position of the microRNA on the chromosome. It marks where the sequence ends, also measured in base pairs, and complements the contig_start to define the full genomic range of the microRNA

Â indicates the starting base pair position of the microRNA on the chromosome. It provides the genomic location from which the microRNA sequence begins, measured in base pairs from the 5' end of the sense strand
indicating the direction of transcription, + or -
pecifies the chromosome where the microRNA is located. It maps microRNA identifiers to their corresponding chromosomes, which may include multiple chromosomes for some microRNAs
The exon or intron number where the miRNA resides.
Indicates the strand orientation of the overlap; typically '+' for sense or '-' for antisense.
Specifies the genomic feature where the miRNA is located, such as exon, intron, 5UTR, or 3UTR.
The Ensembl transcript ID (e.g., ENST00000335137) associated with the miRNA.
The name of the transcript, which may correspond to a gene symbol or other identifier.
The source of the transcript annotation, such as HGNC or miRBase
Internal ID referring to the external database links to mirna_database_url
Conmon name of the mirna, for example let-7 or mir-1
A unique internal ID for each external database
A user-friendly name of the external database (e.g., "Ensembl", "HGNC", etc.).
The actual link to the databases
Auto -incremental Mature miRNA ID of mirBase
Flag indicating if miRNA is dead
Auto -incremental Mature miRNA ID of mirBase
This is NOT the probabiliy, is the species ID from TargetScan
Organ Tissue Specificity Index (TSI) is a measure of how specific the expression of a non-coding RNA (ncRNA) is to a particular tissue or organ system.
Where was the data downloaded from
